BREAKING NEWS: Billboard.biz reports...The Kobalt Music Group, via funds raised by Kobalt Capital Ltd, plans to invest $100 million over the next 12 months in paying advances and buying copyrights. Through its subsidiary Kobalt Capital, the company raised $75 million in equity from investors, including $12 million from Kobalt Music itself, the company said. Those funds will be used to pay out the bigger advances when needed in going up against the major music publishers. The remainder $25 million, if needed, will come from leveraging the equity by drawing down funding from the company's credit facilities.
